caption.p: ( a) Daily prevalence of infection in the case of no responsiveness of the population ( q = 1 bold gray line) and in the baseline scenario ( q = 0. 85, bold red line). The horizontal gray line represents the prevalence threshold 1 ∕ m. The behavioral response appears about 4 days after the perceived prevalence M( t) = I( t) crosses the threshold 1 ∕ m producing a lower increase in the prevalence of infection. ( b) The dynamics of 1 − x ( blue line, scale on the left) and the effective reproductive number over time ( dark green line, scale on the right)
